other.name: War Howl
other.description: While this model is leading a BLOOD CLAWS unit, each time a model in that unit makes a melee attack, you can re‑roll the Wound roll. While this model is leading a WOLF GUARD HEADTAKERS unit, that unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.

other.name: Battle-lust
other.description: Each time this model ends a Charge move, until the end of the turn, add 2 to the Attacks characteristic of this model’s Frostfang weapon.

datasheets.fluff: Supremely confident and eager always to be first into the fray, Wolf Lord Ragnar Blackmane regularly leads his Great Company in devastating planetary invasions. No longer as headstrong as in his youth, Ragnar’s berserk rages are still furious hurricanes of violence, and his terrifying howls freeze the blood of his foes.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ BLOOD CLAWS ■ WOLF GUARD HEADTAKERS
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: bolt pistol; Frostfang.
datasheets.name: Ragnar Blackmane
wargear: None

other.name: Thunderous Charge
other.description: Each time a model in this unit makes a melee attack with its Wolf Guard weapon, if it made a Charge move this turn, add 1 to the Damage characteristic of that attack.

wargear.name: Storm Shield
wargear.description: The bearer has a 4+ invulnerable save.

wargear.name: Storm Shield
wargear.description: The bearer has a 4+ invulnerable save.

datasheets.fluff: Thunderwolves are monstrous and solitary alpha predators, and only the most dauntless elite within the Wolf Guard have the dominance to ride them to war. When they charge, crushing jaws tear through armoured plates, flesh and bone with feral butchery, while the thunderwolves’ riders hack down the foe with heroic ferocity.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: bolt pistol; teeth and claws; Wolf Guard weapon.
datasheets.name: Thunderwolf Cavalry
wargear: For every 3 models in this unit, one model’s bolt pistol can be replaced with 1 plasma pistol.
Any number of models can each have their bolt pistol replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 boltgun ◦ 1 storm shield

other.name: Cunning Hunters
other.description: Each time a model in this unit makes an attack, re‑roll a Wound roll of 1. If the target is within range of an objective marker, you can re‑roll the Wound roll instead.

datasheets.fluff: With their instinctive raw aggression tempered – but never quashed – by countless battlefield victories, Grey Hunters are patient, cunning and adaptable. Some packs take and hold ground, unleashing volleys of disciplined firepower, while others stalk the flanks. When the trap is set, Grey Hunters leap in for the kill.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: bolt carbine; bolt pistol; Astartes chainsword.
datasheets.name: Grey Hunters
wargear: The Grey Hunter Pack Leader’s Astartes Chainsword can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 power fist ◦ 1 power weapon
The Grey Hunter Pack Leader’s bolt carbine can be replaced with 1 plasma pistol.

other.name: Predatory Instinct
other.description: Once per turn, when an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move within 9" of this unit, it can make a Normal move of up to D6".

other.name: Hunting Hounds
other.description: While this unit is within 6" of one or more friendly SPACE WOLVES CHARACTER models (excluding WULFEN models), if this unit is not Battle‑shocked, models in it have an Objective Control characteristic of 1.

datasheets.fluff: Amongst the most vicious and intelligent predators in the galaxy, Fenrisian Wolves accompany the sons of Russ to battle, following them as the pack follows the alpha. Even the sleekest are as big as a Human, yet they prowl silently before pouncing in a swift and coordinated flurry of razor-sharp teeth and claws.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: teeth and claws.
datasheets.name: Fenrisian Wolves
wargear: None

other.name: Healing Balms
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, in your Command phase, you can return 1 destroyed model (excluding CHARACTER models) to that unit.

other.name: Litany of Hate
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes a melee attack, add 1 to the Wound roll.

special.description:
This model can be attached to the following units:

■ BLOOD CLAWS
■ GREY HUNTERS
■ WOLF GUARD HEADTAKERS
special.name: LEADER

datasheets.fluff: Wolf Priests are elder sages who tend to their battle‑brothers’ spiritual and physical well‑being. In battle, they inspire by bellowing litanies and extracts from epic sagas. Clad in black, bedecked with shamanistic totems and wearing macabre wolf‑skull helms, they are terrifying to behold.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: absolvor bolt pistol; crozius arcanum.
datasheets.name: Wolf Priest
wargear: None

other.name: Let Loose the Wolves
other.description: At the start of the Declare Battle Formations step, split this unit into two units, one containing all of its HEADTAKERS models and one containing all of its HUNTING WOLVES models, with new Starting Strengths accordingly.

other.name: Headhunters
other.description: At the start of the battle, select one unit from your opponent’s army to be this unit’s quarry. Weapons equipped by HEADTAKERS models in this unit have the [DEVASTATING WOUNDS] and [PRECISION] abilities while targeting its quarry. Each time this unit’s quarry is destroyed, select one new enemy unit to be this unit’s quarry. This ability can be used even if this unit is embarked within a TRANSPORT.

other.name: Hunting Hounds
other.description: While this unit is within 6" of one or more friendly SPACE WOLVES CHARACTER models (excluding WULFEN models), if this unit is not Battle‑shocked, HUNTING WOLVES models in it have an Objective Control characteristic of 1.

wargear.name: Storm Shield
wargear.description: The bearer has a 4+ invulnerable save.

datasheets.fluff: It is the duty of Wolf Guard Headtakers to break through the enemy line and hunt down commanders and champions. In this task, they are aided by packs of Fenrisian hunting wolves. These cunning beasts scatter enemy formations and harry the Headtakers’ prey, enabling their handlers to close in and dispense the Allfather’s justice with their master‑crafted weapons.
datasheets.loadout:
Every Wolf Guard Headtaker is equipped with: heavy boltpistol; master‑crafted power weapon; storm shield.
Every Hunting Wolf is equipped with: teeth and claws.
datasheets.name: Wolf Guard Headtakers
wargear: All of the models in this unit can each have their master‑crafted power weapon and storm shield replaced with 1 paired master‑crafted power weapons.

other.name: Iron Priest
other.description: While this model is within 3" of one or more friendly ADEPTUS ASTARTES VEHICLE units, this model has the Lone Operative ability.

other.name: Gift of the Iron Wolf
other.description: In your Command phase, you can select one friendly ADEPTUS ASTARTES VEHICLE model within 3" of this model. That model regains up to D3 lost wounds and, until the start of your next Command phase, select one ranged weapon equipped by that model to have the [RAPID FIRE 1] ability. Each model can only be selected for this ability or the Blessing of the Omnissiah ability once per turn.

other.name: Judgement of the Omnissiah
other.description: Each time this model makes an attack that targets an enemy unit within Engagement Range of one or more friendly ADEPTUS ASTARTES VEHICLE units, you can re‑roll the Wound roll.

datasheets.fluff: Space Wolves Techmarines – the Iron Priests – are holders of arcane technological lore that they use to repair the Chapter’s damaged war engines and soothe their affronted machine spirits. Warriors of Fenris first and foremost, Iron Priests will not hesitate to bring their own esoteric weapons to bear on the foe if needed.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ BLOOD CLAWS ■ GREY HUNTERS ■ WOLF GUARD HEADTAKERS
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: helfrost pistol; tempest hammer and servo‑arm.
datasheets.name: Iron Priest
wargear: None

other.name: Wind Walker (Psychic)
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, ranged weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [ASSAULT] ability and each time that unit Advances, do not make an Advance roll. Instead, until the end of the phase, add 6" to the Move characteristic of models in this unit.

other.name: Tempest’s Wrath (Psychic)
other.description: In your Shooting phase, after this model’s unit has shot, select one enemy unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) hit by one or more of those attacks made with this model’s Living Lightning weapon. Until the start of your next turn, that enemy unit is stormwracked. While a unit is stormwracked, subtract 6" from the Range characteristic of ranged weapons equipped by models in that unit (to a minimum of 12").

datasheets.fluff: Summoning ice-toothed blizzards to scatter his foes, Njal Stormcaller is an elemental focus of psychic fury. He is High Rune Priest of the Space Wolves and wields a crackling staff by which he nullifies enemy sorceries.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ BLOOD CLAWS ■ GREY HUNTERS ■ WOLF GUARD HEADTAKERS
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: bolt pistol; Living Lightning; Staff of the Stormcaller.
datasheets.name: Njal Stormcaller
wargear: None

other.name: Berserk Charge
other.description: This unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.

datasheets.fluff: Young and fiery warriors full of belligerent enthusiasm, Blood Claws hunger to prove themselves in savage battle. They plunge headlong into the foe with relentless exuberance, straddling the line between sheer heroism and recklessness. Many great sagas start with the Blood Claws’ glory hunts.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: bolt pistol; Astartes chainsword.
datasheets.name: Blood Claws
wargear: The Blood Claw Pack Leader’s Astartes chainsword can be replaced with 1 power weapon.
The Blood Claw Pack Leader’s bolt pistol can be replaced with 1 plasma pistol.

other.name: Slayer’s Oath
other.description: At the start of the battle, select one of the following keywords to be this model’s Slayer’s Oath: CHARACTER; MONSTER; VEHICLE. The first time this model’s unit destroys a unit with this model’s Slayer’s Oath keyword, if your Detachment rule has a Saga, until the end of the battle, this model’s unit receives the benefits of that Detachment rule as if that Saga had been completed.

other.name: Oathbound
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit makes a melee attack, add 1 to the Hit roll. If that attack targets a unit that has this model’s Slayer’s Oath keyword (see Slayer’s Oath), add 1 to the Wound roll as well.

datasheets.fluff: A paragon of wisdom and experience, Ulrik the Slayer has mentored many of the Space Wolves’ greatest champions. He is the Wolf High Priest, inspiring all who fight alongside him with his aggression and martial prowess. Turning his fearsome gaze upon mighty foes, Ulrik swears weighty oaths to cut them down.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ BLOOD CLAWS ■ GREY HUNTERS ■ WOLF GUARD HEADHUNTERS
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: plasma pistol; artificer crozius arcanum.
datasheets.name: Ulrik the Slayer
wargear: None

other.name: High King of Fenris
other.description: Once per battle round, in your Movement phase, you can select one friendly SPACE WOLVES unit that is in Strategic Reserves. If you do, until the end of the phase, for the purpose of setting up that unit on the battlefield, treat the current battle round number as being one higher than it actually is.

other.name: Guile of the Wolf (Aura)
other.description: Each time your opponent targets a unit from their army with a Stratagem, if that unit is within 12" of this model, increase the cost of that usage of that Stratagem by 1CP (this is not cumulative with any other rules that increase the CP cost of that Stratagem).

special.description: This model can embark within friendly ADEPTUS ASTARTES TRANSPORT models that can transport TERMINATOR models. When doing so, it takes up the space of 4 Infantry models.
special.name: Embarking Within Transports

datasheets.fluff: Logan Grimnar – Great Wolf and High King of Fenris – is one of the longest serving Chapter Masters. Waging war against any who threaten the Space Wolves or the Imperium, Grimnar’s charisma and centuries of heroic victories have immortalised him as one of the most lauded warriors in the galaxy.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ WOLF GUARD TERMINATORS
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: storm bolter; Axe Morkai; Tyrnak and Fenrir.
datasheets.name: Logan Grimnar
wargear: None

other.name: Rugged Resilience
other.description: Each time an attack targets this unit, if the Strength characteristic of that attack is greater than the Toughness characteristic of this unit, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

wargear.name: Storm Shield
wargear.description: The bearer has a Wounds characteristic of 4.

wargear.name: Storm Shield
wargear.description: The bearer has a Wounds characteristic of 4.

datasheets.fluff: Wolf Guard bedeck their Terminator armour with totems, trophies and marks of honour gained over their years of battle. They fight at the spearhead of assaults, eagerly seeking glory as enemy fire deflects harmlessly from their relic armour, the earth shaking beneath their heavy tread as they slay with stunning skill.
datasheets.loadout:
The Wolf Guard Terminator Pack Leader is equipped with: storm bolter; master‑crafted power weapon.
Every Wolf Guard Terminator is equipped with: storm bolter; master‑crafted power weapon.
datasheets.name: Wolf Guard Terminators
wargear: The Wolf Guard Terminator Pack Leader’s storm bolter and master‑crafted power weapon can be replaced with 1 of the following: ◦ 1 relic greataxe ◦ 1 twin lightning claws
For every 5 models in this unit, 1 Wolf Guard Terminator can replace its storm bolter and master‑crafted power weapon with 1 assault cannon and 1 power fist.
Any number of models can each have their storm bolter replaced with 1 storm shield.

other.name: Fervour of the Ancients (Aura)
other.description: While a friendly SPACE WOLVES unit is within 6" of this model, add 1 to Advance and Charge rolls made for that unit.

wargear.name: Blizzard Shield
wargear.description: The bearer has a 4+ invulnerable save.

datasheets.fluff: Venerable Dreadnoughts are priceless relics steeped in centuries of battle. The ancient warriors at the heart of each are living legends of the Space Wolves, with wisdom as deep as the ocean and intuition as sharp as krakens’ teeth. Awoken from dormancy, they fight as lords of battle, seemingly stepping from the sagas to kill in the name of Russ.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: assault cannon; storm bolter; Dreadnought combat weapon.
datasheets.name: Venerable Dreadnought
wargear: This model’s assault cannon, storm bolter and Dreadnought combat weapon can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 Fenrisian great axe, 1 blizzard shield and 1 storm bolter ◦ 1 Fenrisian great axe, 1 blizzard shield and 1 heavy flamer
This model’s storm bolter can be replaced with 1 heavy flamer.
This model’s assault cannon can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 helfrost cannon ◦ 1 multi-melta

other.name: Bestial Rage
other.description: Each time an enemy unit is selected to shoot, after that unit has shot, if this model lost one or more wounds as a result of those attacks, this model can make a Bestial Rage move. To do so, roll one D6, adding 2 to the result: this model can be moved a number of inches up to the result, but must finish that move as close as possible to the closest enemy unit (excluding AIRCRAFT). When doing so, this model can be moved within Engagement Range of that enemy unit. Each model can only make one Bestial Rage move per phase.

other.name: Violent Fury
other.description: If this model is equipped with two melee weapons, those weapon profiles have the [TWIN-LINKED] ability.

wargear.name: Blizzard Shield
wargear.description: The bearer has a 4+ invulnerable save.

datasheets.fluff: Even near death and interred in a Dreadnought sarcophagus, a warrior may yet succumb to the Curse of the Wulfen. Joints and servos twitch and spasm like a crazed animal’s muscles as a Wulfen Dreadnought seeks to maul and eviscerate. From emitters, baleful howls blare its mindless hunger for violence.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: storm bolter; Fenrisian greataxe; great wolf claw.
datasheets.name: Wulfen Dreadnought
wargear: If this model is not equipped with a storm bolter, its heavy flamer can be replaced with 1 storm bolter.
This model’s Fenrisian great axe or great wolf claw and storm bolter can be replaced with 1 blizzard shield and 1 heavy flamer.

other.name: Hammer Blow
other.description: In the Fight phase, after this unit has fought, select one enemy MONSTER or VEHICLE unit hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the end of the next turn, that enemy unit is suppressed. While a unit is suppressed, each time a model in that unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

wargear.name: Death Totem
wargear.description: Each time the bearer makes a melee attack, re‑roll a Hit roll of 1.

datasheets.fluff: When faced with armoured formations or monstrous xenos foes, the Space Wolves may equip their Wulfen warriors with thunder hammers and storm shields. Armed thus, Wulfen warriors can deflect even the heaviest barrage of fire and close with their prey, bringing their thunder hammers to bear and cracking open reinforced armour with ease.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: thunder hammer; death totem.
datasheets.name: Wulfen with Storm Shields
wargear: Any number of models can each have their death totem replaced with 1 stormfrag auto‑launcher.

other.name: Legendary Tenacity
other.description: Each time an attack targets this model, if the Strength characteristic of that attack is greater than this model’s Toughness characteristic, subtract 1 from the Wound roll.

other.name: Ancient Tactician
other.description: At the start of your Command phase, if this model is on the battlefield, you gain 1CP.

datasheets.fluff: Most ancient of all Space Marines and last of the Company of Russ, Bjorn the Fell-Handed has fought for millennia within a Dreadnought’s sarcophagus. The Space Wolves revere Bjorn as a living link to their deepest past, waking him only in times of dire need, and he still fights as furiously as he did at Russ’ side.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: assault cannon; heavy flamer; Trueclaw.
datasheets.name: Bjorn the Fell-Handed
wargear: This model’s assault cannon can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ Helfrost cannon ◦ Multi-melta

other.name: Anvil of Endurance
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, each time a model in that unit is destroyed by a melee attack, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6: on a 4+, do not remove the destroyed model from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

other.name: Champion of the Kingsguard
other.description: Each time this model makes a melee attack that targets a CHARACTER unit, you can re‑roll the Hit roll and you can re‑roll the Wound roll.

datasheets.fluff: Arjac Rockfist is a towering mass of muscle and a taciturn anvil of endurance. Wielding the enormous Foehammer – recalling his former role as an Iron Priest of the forge – Arjac crushes his foes with pulverising strength. As personal champion of the Great Wolf, Arjac upholds the honour of the Chapter.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ WOLF GUARD TERMINATORS
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: Foehammer.
datasheets.name: Arjac Rockfist
wargear: None

other.name: Tempered Ferocity
other.description: While this model is leading a unit, weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [SUSTAINED HITS 1] ability and, each time a model in that unit makes an attack that targets an enemy unit within 6", re‑roll a Hit roll of 1.

other.name: Heroic Last Stand
other.description: If this model is destroyed by a melee attack, if it has not fought this phase, roll one D6: on a 2+, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

wargear.name: Storm Shield
wargear.description: The bearer has a Wounds characteristic of 6.

datasheets.fluff: Mighty champions all, these warriors are entrusted by their Wolf Lords with the responsibility of leadership and demonstrate an exceptional gift for strategic command. As members of the Wolf Guard, Battle Leaders have access to a range of relic weapons, enabling them to lead their warriors into the fray, as Fenrisian tradition demands.
datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following units: ■ BLOOD CLAWS ■ GREY HUNTERS ■ WOLF GUARD HEADTAKERS
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: master‑crafted power weapon; storm shield.
datasheets.name: Wolf Guard Battle Leader
wargear: This model’s storm shield can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 master‑crafted bolt carbine ◦ 1 master‑crafted heavy bolt pistol ◦ 1 plasma pistol
This model’s master‑crafted power weapon can be replaced with 1 thunder hammer.

other.name: Savage Frenzy
other.description: Each time an enemy unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) within Engagement Range of this unit Falls Back, all models in that enemy unit must take a Desperate Escape test. When doing so, if that enemy unit is Battle‑shocked, subtract 1 from each of those tests.

wargear.name: Death Totem
wargear.description: Each time the bearer makes a melee attack, re‑roll a Hit roll of 1.

datasheets.fluff: Wulfen exist on the brink of constant berserk rages, and their chilling howls unleash the inner beast in the sons of Russ nearby. They are bestial warriors, altered by the curse lying in the blood of all scions of the Wolf King. They are hunters, bounding forward with fangs bared and claws outstretched.
datasheets.loadout: Every model is equipped with: Wulfen weapons; death totem.
datasheets.name: Wulfen
wargear: Any number of models can each have their death totem replaced with 1 stormfrag auto‑launcher.

other.name: Murder-maker
other.description: In the Fight phase, each time an attack targets a friendly WULFEN unit within 6" of this model, if a model in that unit is destroyed as a result of that attack, if that model has not fought this phase, roll one D6: on a 4+, do not remove the destroyed model from play; it can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and is then removed from play.

other.name: Bestial Fury
other.description: You can re‑roll Advance and Charge rolls made for this model.

special.description: This model cannot be your WARLORD.
special.name: Force of Untamed Destruction

datasheets.fluff: A stampeding mechanical beast is unleashed from beneath the Fang in times of need, its massively brutal claws tearing its foes limb from bloody limb. The Chapter names it Murderfang. Its true identity is unknown for its insensate snarling rages are bereft of speech; it is known now only as a force of untamed destruction.
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: heavy flamer; storm bolter; Murderclaws.
datasheets.name: Murderfang
wargear: None

other.description: If a friendly Adeptus Astartes Vehicle model is destroyed within 12" of this model, until the end of the battle, this model’s Iron Priest hammer has an Attacks characteristic of 6.
other.name: Vengeance of the Omnissiah

other.description: In your Command phase, you can select one friendly Adeptus Astartes Vehicle model within 3" of this model. That model regains up to D3 lost wounds and, until the start of your next Command phase, each time that Vehicle model makes an attack, add 1 to the Hit roll. Each model can only be selected for this ability once per turn.
other.name: Blessing of the Omnissiah

other.description: While this model is within 3" of one or more friendly Adeptus Astartes Vehicle units, this model has the Lone Operative ability
other.name: Iron Priest

datasheets.leader: This model can be attached to the following unit: ■ Thunderwolf Cavalry
datasheets.loadout: This model is equipped with: boltgun; crushing teeth and claws; Iron Priest hammer; servo-arm.
datasheets.name: Iron Priest On Thunderwolf
wargear: This model’s boltgun can be replaced with one of the following: ◦ 1 bolt pistol ◦ 1 helfrost pistol

enhancements.name: Wolves’ Wisdom
enhancements.description: ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY model only. The bearer’s unit can declare a charge against one or more units within 6" instead of within 3" when using The Great Wolf Watches Detachment rule.

enhancements.name: Foes’ Fate
enhancements.description: ADEPTUS ASTARTES TERMINATOR model only. Each time an enemy unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) within Engagement Range of the bearer’s unit Falls Back, all models in that enemy unit must take Desperate Escape tests. When doing so, if that enemy unit is Battle‑shocked, subtract 1 from each of those tests.

enhancements.name: Fangrune Pendant
enhancements.description: ADEPTUS ASTARTES TERMINATOR model only. The bearer’s unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.

enhancements.name: Longstrider
enhancements.description: ADEPTUS ASTARTES model only. You can re‑roll Charge rolls made for the bearer’s unit.

enhancements.name: Swift Hunter
enhancements.description: SPACE WOLVES model only. Models in the bearer’s unit have the Scouts 7" ability.

enhancements.name: Fenrisian Grit
enhancements.description: ADEPTUS ASTARTES model only. The bearer has the Feel No Pain 4+ ability.

enhancements.name: Wolf Master
enhancements.description: SPACE WOLVES model only. In your Command phase, select one friendly SPACE WOLVES unit within 9" of the bearer. Until the start of your next Command phase, teeth and claws and Tyrnak and Fenrir weapons equipped by models in that unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.

enhancements.name: Feral Rage
enhancements.description: ADEPTUS ASTARTES model only. Add 1 to the Attacks characteristic of melee weapons equipped by the bearer. Each time the bearer ends a Charge move, until the end of the turn, add an additional 1 to the Attacks characteristic of those weapons.

enhancements.name: Braggart’s Steel
enhancements.description: SPACE WOLVES model only. Add 2 to the Strength characteristic of melee weapons equipped by the bearer. If the bearer’s unit has achieved one or more Boasts, add 1 to the Damage characteristic of those weapons as well.

enhancements.name: Skjald
enhancements.description: ADEPTUS ASTARTES model only. Each time a SPACE WOLVES CHARACTER unit from your army achieves a Boast, if the bearer is on the battlefield, you gain 1CP.

enhancements.name: Hordeslayer
enhancements.description: SPACE WOLVES model only. At the start of the Fight phase, if there are more enemy models than friendly models wholly within 6" of the bearer, until the end of the phase, add 2 to the Attacks characteristic of melee weapons equipped by the bearer. If the bearer’s unit has achieved one or more Boasts, add 3 to the Attacks characteristic instead.

enhancements.name: Thunderwolf’s Fortitude
enhancements.description: ADEPTUS ASTARTES model only. The first time the bearer is destroyed, remove it from play, then, at the end of the phase, roll one D6: on a 2+, set the bearer back up on the battlefield as close as possible to where it was destroyed and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units, with 3 wounds remaining.

enhancements.name: Wolf-touched
enhancements.description: SPACE WOLVES model only. Add 2" to the Move characteristic of the bearer. In the Declare Battle Formations step, the bearer can be attached to a WULFEN INFANTRY unit.

enhancements.name: Hunter’s Guile
enhancements.description: ADEPTUS ASTARTES model only. After both players have deployed their armies, select up to three THUNDERWOLF CAVALRY, WULFEN and/or BLOOD CLAWS units from your army and redeploy them. When doing so, you can set those units up in Strategic Reserves if you wish, regardless of how many units are already in Strategic Reserves.

enhancements.name: Elder’s Guidance
enhancements.description: SPACE WOLVES model only. Once per battle, at the start of the Fight phase, if the bearer is leading a BLOOD CLAWS unit, the bearer can use this Enhancement. If it does, until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in that unit by 1.

enhancements.name: Helm of the Beastslayer
enhancements.description: ADEPTUS ASTARTES model only. Each time an attack made by a CHARACTER, MONSTER or VEHICLE model targets the bearer’s unit, reduce the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.

rule.text:
At the end of your opponent’s Charge phase, each **ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY** and **ADEPTUS ASTARTES WALKER** unit from your army that is within 3" of one or more enemy units and would be eligible to declare a charge against one or more of those units can declare a charge against one or more of those units, and you resolve that charge as if it were your Charge phase. If that charge is successful, your unit does not receive any Charge bonus this turn.

While **ADEPTUS ASTARTES TERMINATOR** units from your army are not Battle‑shocked, add 1 to the Objective Control characteristic of models in those units.

At the start of the first battle round, select one of the Sagas listed below (excluding Saga of Majesty); that Saga is considered to be completed by your army, and all **ADEPTUS ASTARTES** models from your army gain the associated benefit until the end of the battle.

At the end of each player’s turn, you can select one of the Sagas listed below (excluding the Saga you selected at the start of the first battle round). If that Saga was completed by your army during that turn, all **ADEPTUS ASTARTES** models from your army gain the associated benefit until the end of the battle. You can only select each Saga once per battle.

■ This Saga is completed if one or more **ADEPTUS ASTARTES CHARACTER** models from your army destroyed one or more enemy **CHARACTER** models during that turn.
■ **Benefit Once Completed**: Melee weapons equipped by **ADEPTUS ASTARTES** models from your army have the **[SUSTAINED HITS 1]** ability.

■ This Saga is completed if you controlled one or more objective markers in your opponent’s deployment zone at the end of that turn, and one or more **ADEPTUS ASTARTES CHARACTER** models from your army were within range of that objective marker.
■ **Benefit Once Completed**: Improve the Objective Control characteristic of **ADEPTUS ASTARTES** models from your army by 1.

■ This Saga is completed if one or more **ADEPTUS ASTARTES CHARACTER** models from your army were reduced to below half of their starting number of wounds during that turn, but were not destroyed at the end of that turn.
■ **Benefit Once Completed**: **ADEPTUS ASTARTES** models from your army have the Feel No Pain 6+ ability.

■ This Saga is completed if one or more **ADEPTUS ASTARTES CHARACTER** models from your army destroyed one or more enemy **MONSTER** or **VEHICLE** models during that turn.
■ **Benefit Once Completed**: Melee weapons equipped by **ADEPTUS ASTARTES** models from your army have the **[LETHAL HITS]** ability.

stratagems.name: Unbridled Ferocity
stratagems.target: One SPACE WOLVES unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, add 1 to the Wound roll.
stratagems.fluff: The Space Wolves fight with a savage fury that enables them to overcome even the most resilient targets.

stratagems.name: Overwhelming Onslaught
stratagems.target: Two ADEPTUS ASTARTES units from your army within Engagement Range of that enemy unit, or one SPACE WOLVES BEASTS unit from your army within Engagement Range of that enemy unit.
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in that enemy unit makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.
stratagems.fluff: Several packs converge upon a single target, pinning them in place with the weight of their bodies.

stratagems.name: Marked for Destruction
stratagems.target: Two ADEPTUS ASTARTES units from your army (excluding BEASTS) that have not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Select one enemy unit visible to both of your units. Until the end of the phase, models in your units can only target that enemy unit (and only if it is an eligible target) and each time a model in one of your units makes an attack, re‑roll a Wound roll of 1.
stratagems.fluff: At the barked orders of their Pack Leaders, the Space Wolves focus their fury upon a single target, combining their firepower to bring the foe down.

stratagems.name: Inspiring Presence
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES CHARACTER unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, melee weapons equipped by models in your unit have the [LETHAL HITS] ability.
stratagems.fluff: The inspiring presence of a champion lends their pack’s strikes lethal impetus.

stratagems.name: Champion’s Guidance
stratagems.target: One SPACE WOLVES CHARACTER unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes an attack, you can re‑roll the Hit roll.
stratagems.fluff: A paragon of Fenrisian savagery, this champion guides his warriors with confidence and precision.

stratagems.name: Birth of a Saga
stratagems.target: One Wolf Guard Headtaker or Wolf Guard Terminator Pack Leader model from your army.
stratagems.when: Your Command phase.
stratagems.effect:
Until the start of your next Command phase, your model has the CHARACTER keyword.

Designer’s Note: While in effect, your model’s unit is therefore a CHARACTER unit, meaning it can interact with the Heroes All rule (see Detachment Rules section), in addition to other rules that interact with CHARACTER units.
stratagems.fluff: Heroes are forged in the heat of battle, rising from obscurity to become the warriors of epic sagas.

stratagems.name: Alpha Strike
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES CHARACTER unit from your army.
stratagems.when: Your Charge phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Advanced.
stratagems.fluff: A true alpha wolf leads by example, and is always first into the fray.

stratagems.name: Heroic Resolve
stratagems.target: One SPACE WOLVES CHARACTER unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time an attack is allocated to a model in your unit, subtract 1 from the Damage characteristic of that attack.
stratagems.fluff: This warrior’s indomitable fortitude is the stuff of legend, galvanizing his pack to remain standing before an avalanche of incoming attacks.

stratagems.name: Countercharge
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES CHARACTER unit from your army that is within 6" of one or more enemy units and would be eligible to declare a charge against one or more of those enemy units if it were your Charge phase.
stratagems.when: End of your opponent’s Charge phase.
stratagems.effect: Your unit now declares a charge that targets only one or more of those enemy units, and you resolve that charge as if it were your Charge phase. Note that even if this charge is successful, your unit does not receive any Charge bonus this turn.
stratagems.fluff: Bellowing encouragement, this warrior rallies his pack and leads a furious counterstrike, intercepting the enemy advance before it can fall upon his allies.

stratagems.name: Shock Cavalry
stratagems.target: One THUNDERWOLF CAVALRY unit from your army that has not been selected to move or declared a charge this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase or your Charge phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Normal, Advance, Fall Back or Charge move, it can move through models (excluding TITANIC models) and sections of terrain features that are 4" or less in height. When doing so, it can move within Engagement Range of enemy models, but unless it is making a Charge move, it cannot end that move within Engagement Range of them.
stratagems.fluff: Thunderwolf Cavalry bound through friend and foe, leaping over obstacles in pursuit of their foes.

stratagems.name: Pinning Fire
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, after your unit has shot, select one enemy CHARACTER, MONSTER, or VEHICLE unit hit by one or more of those attacks. Until the start of your next Shooting phase, that unit is pinned. While a unit is pinned, subtract 2" from its Move characteristic and subtract 2 from Charge rolls made for it.
stratagems.fluff: Unleashing a storm of firepower, the Space Wolves pin their targets down and halt their advance.

stratagems.name: Thunderous Pursuit
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that is within 9" of that enemy unit and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Movement phase, just after an enemy unit ends a Normal, Advance or Fall Back move.
stratagems.effect: Your unit can make a Normal move of up to D6". If your unit has the SPACE WOLVES INFANTRY or THUNDERWOLF CAVALRY keywords, it can make a Normal move of up to 6" instead.
stratagems.fluff: The relentless endurance of thunderwolf steeds enables the Space Wolves to run down fleeing foes.

stratagems.name: Impetuosity
stratagems.target: One WULFEN INFANTRY or BLOOD CLAWS unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, after that enemy unit has shot, if one or more models in your unit were destroyed as a result of those attacks, your unit can make an Impetuous move. To do so, roll one D6: your unit can be moved a number of inches up to the result, but your unit must end that move as close as possible to the closest enemy unit (excluding AIRCRAFT). When doing so, those models can be moved within Engagement Range of that enemy unit.
stratagems.fluff: Severe losses only drive Blood Claws and Wulfen forward into the midst of the foe.

stratagems.name: Coordinated Strike
stratagems.target: One SPACE WOLVES unit from your army that is wholly within 9" of one or more battlefield edges and not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
stratagems.when: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.
stratagems.fluff: Space Wolves officers rein in their warriors’ impulsive fury, repositioning them to strike exposed flanks.

stratagems.name: Chilling Howl
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES TERMINATOR unit from your army.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Command phase.
stratagems.effect: Each enemy unit within 6" of your unit must take a Battle‑shock test, subtracting 1 from that test if that unit is Below Half‑strength.
stratagems.fluff: Raising their feral voices as one, the elite champions of Fenris give voice to a predatory howl fit to freeze the marrow of the bravest warriors.

stratagems.name: Stalking Wolves
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, models in your unit have the Stealth ability.
stratagems.fluff: These veteran warriors approach the foe like wolves on the hunt. They are ever‑poised to drop into cover or fade into the shadows to avoid their prey’s increasingly desperate attempts to drive them of.

stratagems.name: Onrushing Storm
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES TERMINATOR unit from your army that is not within Engagement Range of one or more enemy units.
stratagems.when: End of your opponent’s Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Remove your unit from the battlefield and place it into Strategic Reserves.
stratagems.fluff: A Fenrisian gunship skims low over the battlefield, touching down just long enough for these elite warriors to embark before it lifts off again. The enemy’s respite will not last long; it will return with its deadly cargo soon enough.

stratagems.name: Preytaker’s Eye
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY unit from your army that has not been selected to shoot or fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Shooting phase or the Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Select either the [LETHAL HITS] or [SUSTAINED HITS 1] abilities. Until the end of the phase, weapons equipped by models in your unit have that ability.
stratagems.fluff: Long and bloody experience has taught these warriors how best to identify the slightest weakness in their prey and exploit it to the fullest.

stratagems.name: Armour of Contempt
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army that was selected as the target of one or more of the attacking unit’s attacks.
stratagems.when: Your opponent’s Shooting phase or the Fight phase, just after an enemy unit has selected its targets.
stratagems.effect: Until the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, each time an attack targets your unit, worsen the Armour Penetration characteristic of that attack by 1.
stratagems.fluff: The belligerence and transhuman physiologies of the Adeptus Astartes make them unyielding foes.

stratagems.name: Runes of Claiming
stratagems.target: One ADEPTUS ASTARTES INFANTRY or ADEPTUS ASTARTES WALKER unit from your army.
stratagems.when: End of your Command phase.
stratagems.effect: Select one objective marker you control that your unit is within range of. That objective marker remains under your control until your opponent’s Level of Control over that objective marker is greater than yours at the end of a phase.
stratagems.fluff: A few quick cuts with a diamond‑keen hunting knife or energised claw tip leave Fenrisian runes carved into bedrock, plasteel or flesh, marks of abjuration against the foe and secret messages between Space Wolves alike.

stratagems.name: Envelop and Ensnare
stratagems.target: One SPACE WOLVES unit (excluding MONSTERS and VEHICLES) from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.when: Fight phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Pile‑in or Consolidation move, it can move up to 6" instead of up to 3". When doing so, it does not need to end that move closer to the closest enemy model, provided it ends that move as close as possible to the closest enemy unit.
stratagems.fluff: The Space Wolves close in on their foes, some packs hurling themselves upon the enemy whilst others move to cut off retreat routes.

stratagems.name: Territorial Advantage
stratagems.target: That ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit.
stratagems.when: Fight phase, just after an enemy unit is destroyed by an ADEPTUS ASTARTES unit from your army.
stratagems.effect: Select one objective marker you control that your unit is within range of. That objective marker remains under your control until your opponent’s Level of Control over that objective marker is greater than yours at the end of a phase.
stratagems.fluff: The wolf packs are ever on the move, seizing ground and repelling their foes with savage violence.

stratagems.name: Chosen Prey
stratagems.target: That SPACE WOLVES unit.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase, just after a SPACE WOLVES unit from your army Falls Back.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the turn, your unit is eligible to shoot and declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back.
stratagems.fluff: Having singled out their prey, the pack repeatedly strikes in waves, bleeding the target with each hit.

stratagems.name: Bounding Advance
stratagems.target: One SPACE WOLVES INFANTRY or SPACE WOLVES BEASTS unit from your army that has not been selected to move or declared a charge this phase.
stratagems.when: Your Movement phase or your Charge phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a Normal, Advance, Fall Back or Charge move, it can move through models (excluding TITANIC models). When doing so, it can move within Engagement Range of enemy models, but unless it is making a Charge move, it cannot end that move within Engagement Range of them.
stratagems.fluff: Fenrisian warriors and wolves surge forward, driving through the enemy line to outflank the foe.
